file_content.text: Bring the datapad back to headquarters. My slicers will crack the decryption.
We'll have to move fast to stop the enemy. Hurry.
We're too late, Rieekan. Darth Angral's apprentice raided the lab. There's nothing left here.
I found an encrypted datapad on an Imperial officer. Looks important.
It may have information on where the enemy's moved to.
Expect the worst in that Power Guard main lab. It's been in enemy hands for a long time.
Only one building in the sector maintained a steady energy supply when you disrupted those power conduits.
That has to be the main lab. Sending coordinates now....
Aside from Agent Galen and the test subjects, we have no idea what you'll face in there. How will you play this?
Whatever surprises the enemy has in store, a Jedi is always ready.
I'll trust in the Force.
I'll give the enemy an opportunity to surrender. If they don't take it, that's their problem.
They get one chance, then bam!
Every Imperial in there will die. I'll make sure of it.
Without mercy.
With luck, you'll catch the opposition off guard. You're in for a hell of a fight.
Here goes nothing....
T7 = fully charged + weapons armed!
Contact me when it's done. Rieekan out.
Just use your lightsaber on the power conduits we marked for you. Trust me, this'll work.
I'm in the Red Light Sector. You have a plan for finding that main lab?
If the Power Guard facility has a dedicated reactor, it's immune to energy fluctuations affecting the power grid.
My team is monitoring energy readings in that sector. All you have to do is cause some fluctuations.
Applying a lightsaber to the right power conduits ought to do the trick.
I assume you have some targets in mind?
Point me at these conduits.
If I disrupt power to an entire city sector, innocent people might be injured.
That could hurt people.
Trust me, no one there is innocent. Regardless, the fluctuations will be short-lived and harmless.
Chief Rieekan = correct // Power surges = no threat to living beings
I solve a lot of problems with my weapon.
Lightsabers are indeed useful.
Wish I had one every time a stack of datapads lands on my desk.
Sending coordinates to key power conduits. Hit them all, and we'll get a fix on that Power Guard main lab.
And be careful. The Red Light Sector may look civilized, but it's nothing of the sort. Rieekan out.
Agent Galen disappeared into that recruitment center. The answers are in there.
Chief Rieekan? I've downloaded all of Agent Galen's coded messages.
Transmitting a decryption signal to your holo. De-scrambling... hmm....
Times and locations... standard tracking details... and one priority holo. Playing that back now.
Found our lead operative--dead. He'd been tortured. The Power Guard data files are missing.
No clues to the main facility's location, but there was evidence of a recruitment center here.
The project was using refugees as test subjects. The recruitment center's my best shot at finding the main facility.
I'm going in. Leaving the site's coordinates, just in case. Galen out.
Took guts, going in there alone.
Agent Galen = brave // T7 = hopes he is safe
Not sure what's worse: the enemy stealing our weapons project, or us experimenting on refugees.
The Sith have stolen the Power Guard project. I have to get it back.
I need to stop the enemy.
A blind assault is dangerous--but it's your only option.
I'm shocked General Var Suthra permitted illegal testing.
The experiments disgust me.
With all the layers of secrecy, he probably didn't know.
I want a full strike team helping me storm that recruitment center.
Send me all your agents.
We're analysts, not commandos.
Agent Galen--or whoever got him--holds the key to recovering the Power Guard project. The trail ends at that recruitment center.
You need to get inside there, find out what's happened. Good luck. Rieekan out.
Good luck in the Nikto Sector. We'll help decrypt Agent Galen's messages once you find all of them.
That's the second field agent who's missed a check-in. Our network's under attack.
We don't know that.
We know Agent Galen was captured. He's telling the enemy where to hit us!
If it makes you feel better, transmit alert level omega to all field agents. See how many respond.
The Jedi who eliminated Watcher One. Glad to meet you--I'm Bureau Chief Rieekan.
Welcome. I'm Bureau Chief Rieekan. General Var Suthra speaks highly of you.
Wish I had better news to report. We're fumbling in the dark right now.
Lighting up the darkness is one of my specialties.
I can help with that.
Sounds like your agents are in trouble.
What's happening?
My subordinate's jumping at shadows. Hazard of the business.
Blind spies aren't much good to me.
Not what I wanted to hear.
In my job, you can't always trust what you see.
Here's what little I know: Agent Galen came here to secure a top secret operation. Something hidden even from us.
Galen disappeared in the Nikto Sector while pursuing a contact. Fortunately, he left a trail we can follow.
It's a start. How do I pick up this trail?
I'll begin my search there.
What do you know about the person Galen was after?
Who was this contact?
The general said it was the operative in charge of his project. More than that, I don't know.
You know Nar Shaddaa better than me. Release your hounds.
Put your people on it.
I tried that. Didn't work out.
Galen left coded progress reports at SIS dead-drops all over the Nikto Sector. Unfortunately, that whole area's gone hostile.
Had to pull my agents out. You want those reports, you'll have to go in alone.
Thank goodness. For a second, I thought this might be too easy.
Agent Galen = good man // Jedi + T7 = need to find him
I sent the omega alert. Only half our field agents responded. I'm telling you, we're compromised!
We need to move this headquarters before it's too late.
The enemy may be trying to flush you into the open. Make you easier to pick off.
That may be a bad idea.
Running and regrouping is better than waiting to die.
Darth Angral is clearly targeting the SIS. Time to move.
I agree.
We'll wipe the computers and leave Nar Shaddaa.
My mission is more important than your safety. Stay where I can find you.
You're not going anywhere.
This is insane. We're sitting targets.
Evacuating this facility is out of the question. We're safe here--and we have a mission to complete.
I've marked the locations of Agent Galen's dead-drops. Download his messages to your holo and contact me. I'll decode them.
Let's get some answers. Good luck.
You're allowed down here because of the company you keep--but we're watching you.
